message.content:
cs.CL, cs.LG, cs.IR, cs.AI, cs.NE

This paper is about Word Sense Disambiguation (WSD) which is a subfield of Computational Linguistics (CL) and Natural Language Processing (NLP). Therefore, cs.CL is the most likely sub-category. The paper also proposes a WSD system that uses topic models, which are a popular machine learning technique used in several subfields of Computer Science. Therefore, cs.LG (Machine Learning) is also a likely sub-category. The paper also mentions the use of WordNet, which is a lexical database used in Information Retrieval (IR) and Artificial Intelligence (AI) applications. Therefore, cs.IR and cs.AI are also likely sub-categories. Finally, the paper proposes a method that scales linearly with the number of words in the context, which involves optimization techniques that are commonly used in Neural Networks (NN) and other subfields of Computer Science. Therefore, cs.NE (Neural and Evolutionary Computing) is also a likely sub-category.
